paragraph.paragraph: WEL is an encapsulation of the Win32 Application Programming Interface (API), and provides users with a powerful means of creating Win32 Applications.
paragraph.heading: 2Components
paragraph.paragraph: The WEL library includes the following clusters:

list.item:
A
/libraries/wel/content/windows/index.html Windows cluster containing classes representing available windows types

A
/libraries/wel/content/controls/index.html Controls cluster containing classes representing available controls

A
/libraries/wel/content/stddlgs/index.html Stddlgs cluster containing classes representing standard Win32 dialogs

A
/libraries/wel/reference/consts/index.html Consts cluster which contains constants used by WEL

A
/libraries/wel/reference/gdi/index.html Gdi cluster which contains classes allowing access to WIN32 Graphics Device Interfaces

A
/libraries/wel/reference/gdistock/index.html Gdistock cluster which contains standard Graphic Device Interfaces used by WEL

A
/libraries/wel/reference/messages/index.html Messages cluster which contains classes encapsulating windows messages

A
/libraries/wel/reference/shared/index.html Shared cluster which contains classes encapsulating system wide shared

A
/libraries/wel/reference/structs/index.html Structs cluster which contains classes for data structures required by Win32

A
/libraries/wel/reference/support/index.html Support cluster which contains many supporting classes
